subject: Communication
title: Virtual Presentations: The Camera Shift
description: A quick win: understand Virtual Presentations: The Camera Shift.

hook.text: COVID-19 forced millions of speakers from stages to screens â€” and most of the old rules broke.

buildup.text: Eye contact means looking at the camera, not the screen. Body language is cropped to shoulders and up.

discovery.text: Stanford researchers found 'Zoom fatigue' comes from constant close-up eye contact and self-view.

twist.text: Virtual speaking is harder, not easier. You get no audience energy, no laughter, no physical feedback.

climax.text: The best virtual speakers adapted: shorter segments, more interaction, and camera as their audience.

punchline.text: The screen isn't a barrier. It's a different stage.

quiz.question: What causes 'Zoom fatigue' according to Stanford research?
options: Constant close-up eye contact and self-view
